title: American Painting and Sculpture 66th Annual
description: This exhibit sought to present recent trends in contemporary American art. Most of the artists included developed their careers after World War II. Among those featured are well known artists such as Alexander Calder, Morris Louis, Ad Reinhardt, and Hans Hoffmann, all of whom were awarded prizes for their works displayed in the show. The show was judged by H. Harvard Arnason, Vice President for the arts administration at the Solomon R. Guggenheim Museum,  James Brooks, a New York painter, and Henry Geldzahler, an assistant curator of American painting and sculpture at the Metropolitan Museum of Art.
